sub_topic: Identifying the automorphism group of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the graph shown below:

```
1 -- 2 -- 3
```

What is the automorphism group of this graph?
message_2:
The automorphism group of a graph is the set of all graph automorphisms (permutations of the vertices that preserve the adjacency relation). In this case, we have the following automorphisms:

1. The identity automorphism, which maps each vertex to itself: (1)(2)(3)
2. The automorphism that swaps vertices 1 and 3: (13)(2)

Thus, the automorphism group of this graph is the group containing these two automorphisms, which is isomorphic to the symmetric group S2 (the group of all permutations of two elements).
